intro: Piper vitiense, commonly known as the New Zealand pepper or Vitiense pepper, is a climbing shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper plants. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that turns red when mature. Piper vitiense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in Māori medicine.
